title: Varicella zoster (Chickenpox) vaccines for children start across UK
summary: The UK government has introduced free chickenpox vaccinations for children on the NHS, a milestone move supported by Encephalitis International to prevent varicella-zoster virus and its life-threatening complication, encephalitis.

title: Psychology Today – The Inflamed Brain (January 2026)
summary: Dr Sophie Binks explores the challenges faced by women in academic medicine, addressing issues such as imposter syndrome and the mentoring needs of the UK academic workforce.

title: TOPS-UK Tailored Online Problem Solving
summary: A research study by the University of Exeter offering a free web-based programme to help adolescents with acquired brain injuries, including encephalitis, manage emotions and develop problem-solving skills.

title: Simple Pleasures: Christmas with a Brain Injury
summary: Catherine Jessop shares her perspective as a caregiver on navigating the challenges of memory loss and finding joy in simple family traditions following her husband's autoimmune encephalitis diagnosis.

title: WED Fundraisers
summary: This page provides resources and guidance for supporters to organize fundraising activities for World Encephalitis Day on 22 February to raise awareness and vital funds.

title: Encephalitis International Wishes Ambassador George Clarke Good Luck for BBC’s Strictly Come Dancing
summary: Encephalitis International ambassador George Clarke reaches the Strictly Come Dancing final, using his platform to share his mother's journey with encephalitis and raise public awareness.

title: Major breakthrough in our understanding of tick-borne virus encephalitis
summary: Scientists have identified the LRP8 protein as a key cell receptor used by the tick-borne encephalitis virus to invade the brain, opening new avenues for vaccine development and antiviral treatments.

title: Reflecting on a Patient Involvement Activity
summary: Researchers from the University of Liverpool share insights on how patient and public involvement (PPIE) is shaping their study on seizures in autoimmune encephalitis.

title: Encephalitis International Publishes in Nature
summary: Encephalitis International announces the publication of a landmark comprehensive review on autoimmune encephalitis in the prestigious journal Nature Reviews Disease Primers, co-authored by its experts to assist healthcare professionals in diagnosis and management.

title: UCB - MOG-AD cosMOG study
summary: The cosMOG study by UCB is investigating the effectiveness and safety of rozanolixizumab in preventing relapses for adults diagnosed with Myelin oligodendrocyte glycoprotein antibody-associated disease (MOG-AD).

title: Psychology Today - The Inflamed Brain (October 2025)
summary: This article explores the complexities of navigating parenthood after a brain injury, highlighting the differences between expected and actual parental roles during long-term recovery.

title: Treatments for Encephalitis
summary: An overview of the medical approaches to treating encephalitis, focusing on addressing the cause of the inflammation and managing symptoms and complications during the acute phase.

title: Intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIG) and plasma exchange for autoimmune encephalitis (AE)
summary: This article explains two major immunotherapies used for treating autoimmune encephalitis: intravenous immunoglobulin (IVIG) and plasma exchange (plasmapheresis), detailing their mechanisms, procedures, and safety profiles.

title: Finding the Silver Linings in Brain Recovery
summary: This blog post provides practical tips, including creative and cognitive exercises, to support mental wellbeing and help individuals navigate the road to recovery after encephalitis.

title: Encephalitis 2025 Programme
summary: The comprehensive programme for the Encephalitis 2025 conference featuring research and clinical presentations on infectious and autoimmune encephalitis management and patient outcomes.

title: Bickerstaff brainstem encephalitis (BBE)
summary: An overview of Bickerstaff brainstem encephalitis (BBE), a rare autoimmune condition affecting the brainstem, detailing its symptoms, diagnosis, and treatment options.

title: Memory Study - UC Davis Health
summary: UC Davis Health is conducting a research study for individuals aged 18 to 75 who have experienced encephalitis to investigate the condition's impact on memory and brain function.

title: The Value of a Legacy
summary: An exploration of the history and impact of legacy giving, highlighting how gifts in wills fund vital research and support services for Encephalitis International.

title: Autoimmune encephalitis associated with MOG antibodies
summary: This factsheet provides a comprehensive overview of MOG antibody-associated disease (MOGAD), covering its clinical manifestations, diagnostic procedures, current treatment options, and long-term recovery outlook.

title: Sam Teale
summary: Sam Teale Productions is an award-winning video production company specializing in emotive storytelling and viral campaigns for brands and charities.

title: Previous campaigns
summary: A directory of past and recurring global initiatives by Encephalitis International aimed at raising awareness, funding research, and advocating for the prevention and treatment of encephalitis.

title: Psychology Today – The Inflamed Brain (August 2025)
summary: This post highlights an article on the 'invisible injury' of brain injury, discussing the psychological challenges survivors face when their symptoms are dismissed due to a normal outward appearance.

title: Co-authored Journal Papers and Publications
summary: This page provides access to academic research papers and publications co-authored by the Encephalitis International team, focusing on nursing, technology in mental health, and patient involvement.

title: Can AI help diagnose autoimmune encephalitis?
summary: Researchers have developed an AI system that analyzes MRI scans to predict antibody status in autoimmune encephalitis patients, potentially speeding up the diagnostic process and treatment initiation.

title: Encephalitis International publishes article on vaccine hesitancy
summary: Encephalitis International has published a research article in the journal Practice Nurse exploring the history, consequences, and modern challenges of vaccine hesitancy.

title: Psychology Today - The Inflamed Brain (July 2025)
summary: This article explores the potential link between common herpesviruses and an increased risk of dementia, discussing the historical context and current uncertainty of the 'Herpes Hypothesis'.

title: My Neurology Academic Clinical Fellowship (ACF): First year - by Dr Abdusshakur Muhammad Auwal
summary: Dr. Abdusshakur Muhammad Auwal reflects on his first year as an Academic Clinical Fellow, highlighting his research on COVID-19 complications and his work producing clinical resources and patient information on encephalitis.

title: Encephalitis International publishes a new paper on Patient and Public Involvement
summary: This paper evaluates the role and impact of Patient and Public Involvement (PPI) within the COVID-CNS study, advocating for the integration of patient voices throughout the research process.

title: Encephalitis International Opens New HQ
summary: Encephalitis International celebrated the official opening of its new Global Headquarters in North Yorkshire with a special event attended by supporters, donors, and local dignitaries.

title: Loneliness measures
summary: This research study by Maria Vize at the University of Surrey seeks to evaluate the effectiveness of loneliness questionnaires for individuals who have experienced encephalitis or other acquired brain injuries and their carers.

title: Exploring the family experiences of childhood brain injury
summary: This research study aims to understand how UK-based families cope and adapt following a child's moderate to severe brain injury, providing recommendations for future support networks.

title: SAPIENCE: Social and psychological long-term impact of NMDAR encephalitis
summary: The SAPIENCE study is an online research survey exploring the long-term social and psychological challenges, such as memory problems and fatigue, faced by individuals recovering from NMDAR encephalitis.

title: Regular Support: Rebuilding Futures Across the World
summary: This article highlights the vital role of Encephalitis International's global online peer support groups, featuring testimonials from survivors and parents on the importance of shared experiences and community in recovery.

title: Psychology Today - The Inflamed Brain (May 2025)
summary: This article highlights a Psychology Today feature on a historical 100-year-old brain disease that affected both the body and mind, discussing its legacy and impact on current research.

title: Encephalitis: After-effects, recovery and rehabilitation
summary: This resource page provides multi-language booklets and guidance focusing on the recovery process, rehabilitation, and long-term after-effects of encephalitis.

title: Visa Resources
summary: Information and guidance for international visitors on obtaining UK visas and letters of invitation to attend Encephalitis International conferences and events.

title: Seed Funding: UK - Dr Sara Simblett
summary: Dr Sara Simblett's COPE-EMBRACE project uses real-time assessment to study the relationship between stress, coping mechanisms, and depression in encephalitis survivors.

title: Seed Funding: Italy - Dr Alessandro Dinoto
summary: Dr Alessandro Dinoto's research project in Verona, Italy, focuses on the epidemiology of autoimmune encephalitis and identifying its clinical mimics to ensure accurate diagnosis and treatment.

title: Seed funding: Uganda
summary: This research project led by Dr. John Kasibante in Uganda evaluates the utility of Biofire PCR technology to identify viral pathogens in patients with encephalitis of unknown aetiology to improve diagnosis and patient care.

title: How Real-Time Technology is Helping Us Understand Stress After Encephalitis
summary: The COPE-EMBRACE study utilized a smartphone app to track real-time stress and mood among encephalitis survivors, highlighting how coping strategies significantly affect long-term mental wellbeing.

title: Encephalitis International’s Fundraising Agreement – Safe, Fun & Legal
summary: This document outlines the essential legal regulations, safety guidelines, and administrative procedures for individuals fundraising on behalf of Encephalitis International.

title: New research on emotional adjustment after encephalitis
summary: A UK study involving Encephalitis International’s CEO evaluated a transdiagnostic cognitive behavioural therapy model to better understand and support the emotional adjustment and identity changes of encephalitis survivors.

title: Football auction!
summary: Encephalitis International is hosting a 10-day charity auction of football memorabilia donated by various clubs in memory of Eleanor Haigh to support their ongoing work and research.

title: Accumulator Challenge
summary: The Accumulator Challenge is a creative fundraising competition for businesses, schools, and organizations to raise funds and awareness for Encephalitis International leading up to World Brain Day.

title: Encephalitis International is Carbon Neutral!
summary: Encephalitis International announces its achievement of carbon neutral status and highlights the connection between climate change and the spread of infectious diseases causing encephalitis.

title: Extraordinary concert raises funds in memory of Eleanor
summary: Peter and Kathy Haigh organized a memorial fundraising concert featuring local choirs that raised £2,500 for Encephalitis International in memory of their daughter, Eleanor.

title: Celebrating 25 years with Dr Ava Easton
summary: An article celebrating the 25-year career and major achievements of Dr. Ava Easton, CEO of Encephalitis International, highlighting her global impact on awareness, research, and patient support.

title: ARBO-UK: UK Prospective Observational Study of Imported Arboviral Infections
summary: This research study examines the impact and treatment of arbovirus infections in UK hospital patients to support the development of better diagnostic tests and vaccines.

title: Scrub typhus encephalitis
summary: An overview of scrub typhus encephalitis, a serious neurological condition caused by the bacterium Orientia tsutsugamushi transmitted by larval mites, detailing its symptoms, geographic distribution, diagnosis, and treatment.

title: Clinical Trials: What are they? And why do they matter?
summary: An introductory guide explaining the purpose, phases, and methodology of clinical trials and observational studies within the context of encephalitis research.

title: Preventing future encephalitis campaign
summary: Encephalitis International highlights the impact of climate change on infectious encephalitis and promotes the critical role of vaccines in preventing diseases such as Japanese encephalitis and West Nile Virus.

title: The What, Why, When and Where of Will Writing
summary: A comprehensive guide explaining the importance of creating a will, the steps involved in estate planning, and how legacy gifts support the work of Encephalitis International.

title: Seed Funding: India 2022 - Dr Tina Damodar
summary: This research project focuses on developing a fast and accurate diagnostic blood test to distinguish scrub typhus from other causes of acute encephalitis syndrome in children.

title: Seed funding: Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center, USA
summary: Dr Oliver Harschnitz at the Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center is using human stem cell models to investigate how SARS-CoV-2 affects dopamine neurons and the potential long-term neurological consequences of COVID-19.

title: Seed funding Senegal
summary: Dr Jamil Kahwagi leads a seed-funded research project in Senegal to implement hospital-based surveillance for identifying viral causes of encephalitis and improving diagnostic accuracy in the region.

title: NeuroAccess – Lusaka, Zambia
summary: A report on the NeuroAccess project in Zambia, which provides neurological education and training to medical professionals to improve care for encephalitis and other conditions in sub-Saharan Africa.

title: NeuroAccess Mozambique July 2014
summary: Drs Benedict Michael and Sam Nightingale visited Beira Public Hospital in Mozambique to provide neurological education and support research into diagnosing brain infections in resource-limited settings.

title: NeuroAccess – Zambia
summary: The NeuroAccess project aims to improve encephalitis care in sub-Saharan Africa through neurology education and training for medical professionals.

title: Seed funding India - Dr. Priyanka Madaan
summary: This research project focuses on validating the Paediatric Autoimmune Encephalitis Severity Score (PASS) to better document and evaluate the clinical severity and treatment outcomes for children with autoimmune encephalitis.

title: Seed Funding: Brazil - Dr Aline de Moura Brasil Matos
summary: This project investigates the clinical and laboratory characteristics of encephalitis during a triple epidemic of Dengue, Zika, and Chikungunya in Brazil to evaluate brain damage and biomarkers.

title: Past Research Projects
summary: A comprehensive overview of global seed-funded research initiatives exploring the epidemiology, diagnosis, and psychological impact of infectious and autoimmune encephalitis.

title: Seed Funding Cameroon
summary: This research project led by Dr Alain Kenfak Foguena investigates the aetiologies, clinical presentations, and neuro-cognitive outcomes of non-HIV associated encephalitis in Cameroon.

title: Seed Funding: Brazil - Dr Aline de Moura Brasil Matos
summary: This report details a pilot study funded in 2019 to investigate the clinical and laboratory characteristics of encephalitis during epidemics of Dengue, Zika, and Chikungunya in Brazil.

title: NeuroAccess - Mozambique
summary: This article details the NeuroAccess project led by Drs Benedict Michael and Sam Nightingale to improve neurology education and clinical care for encephalitis and other brain infections in Mozambique.

title: NeuroAccess – Lusaka, Zambia
summary: An overview of the NeuroAccess project's work in Zambia providing neurological education and clinical training to medical students and junior doctors to improve care for encephalitis and other neurological conditions.

title: Seed Funding - Columbia University, USA: Dr Emily Happy Miller
summary: This research project investigated the neuroinvasive potential of SARS-CoV-2 in brain autopsies to determine if neurological manifestations are caused by direct viral infection or systemic inflammatory responses.

title: Camino Communications
summary: Camino Communications is a medical communications agency that partners with Encephalitis International to deliver innovative marketing campaigns and integrated communication strategies.

title: Svar Wieslab Diagnostic Services
summary: Wieslab offers specialized ISO15189-certified autoimmunity diagnostic services and test panels to support medical professionals in diagnosing encephalitis.

title: Outcomes and impacts of research
summary: This page provides access to published research papers, impact reports, and scientific outcomes resulting from collaborations and studies supported by Encephalitis International.

title: Improving brain infection diagnostics in India
summary: This article details a study in India aimed at enhancing encephalitis diagnosis through hospital process optimization, laboratory collaboration, and clinical training to bridge resource gaps between medical facilities.

title: Improving brain infection diagnostics in Malawi
summary: Dr. Gareth D. Lipunga outlines practical interventions implemented in Malawi to enhance the timely diagnosis and management of brain infections through clinician training, improved laboratory processes, and logistical support.

title: Brain infection diagnostics in Brazil and beyond
summary: Dr Rafael FO Franca explores a multidisciplinary research study across Brazil, India, and Malawi focused on implementing rapid molecular diagnostics and clinical training to improve the management of brain infections in low- and middle-income countries.

title: Brain Infections Global (BI Global) Campaign
summary: The Brain Infections Global (BI Global) study significantly improved the diagnosis and management of acute brain infections in Brazil, India, and Malawi through a clinical intervention package and patient engagement.

title: Encephalitis International Conference 2024
summary: The 2024 Encephalitis International Conference in London brought together over 500 global experts and students to share the latest clinical research and foster international collaboration.

title: Encephalitis 2024: hear from those who were awarded the Conference bursary
summary: Two international neurologists share their experiences and the clinical insights gained into infectious and autoimmune encephalitis during the Encephalitis 2024 conference.

title: Encephalitis 2026 Overview
summary: An announcement and overview for the Encephalitis 2026 conference, a global event focusing on the latest research and clinical challenges in infectious and autoimmune encephalitis.

title: Psychology Today – The Inflamed Brain (March 2025)
summary: This article explores the lessons that should have been learned from global pandemics such as COVID-19, SARS, and MERS in relation to pandemic preparedness and the long-term neurological impacts of infection.

title: Criminality in patients with autoimmune encephalitis
summary: A 2024 study suggests that autoimmune encephalitis may lead to delayed criminal behavior due to permanent changes in the brain's behavioral control centers, particularly when immunotherapy is delayed.

title: 22 Highlights - World Encephalitis Day 2025
summary: A comprehensive review of the 12th World Encephalitis Day campaign, showcasing 22 key milestones including the launch of a WHO Technical Brief, global landmark light-ups, and major research conferences.

title: Encephalitis Technical Brief
summary: The World Health Organization's Technical Brief on Encephalitis identifies the condition as a global public health priority and outlines critical actions for prevention, diagnosis, treatment, and research innovation.

title: World Encephalitis Day History
summary: A comprehensive overview of the history and global impact of World Encephalitis Day since its establishment by Encephalitis International in 2014.

title: Travel Health Xpert
summary: Travel Health Xpert is a specialized resource providing medical professionals with access to high-level scientific publications and bibliographic data on travel health and various diseases.

title: Encephalitis – a growing global threat : Global Policy Launch
summary: An online event hosting the launch of the World Health Organization’s technical brief on encephalitis to discuss global future actions for reducing death and disability.

title: GENIE – A Portuguese association for autoimmune encephalitis research and care
summary: The launch of GENIE in Portugal marks a new interdisciplinary initiative dedicated to advancing research, awareness, and support for those affected by autoimmune encephalitis.

title: Lights, Camera, Encephalitis Awareness!
summary: Encephalitis International representatives attended the world premiere of Bridget Jones: Mad About the Boy, an event hosted by Ambassador Abi Morgan that highlights themes of grief and recovery relevant to the encephalitis community.

title: Psychology Today - The Inflamed Brain (January 2025)
summary: Dr. James Marsh examines the long-term mental health implications of encephalitis and the necessity for holistic recovery care beyond the acute medical phase.

title: World Encephalitis Day Appeal
summary: Encephalitis International is launching its World Encephalitis Day 2025 appeal to raise £50,000 for global advocacy, professional healthcare training, and diagnostic tool improvements.

title: Past Webinars
summary: An archive of educational webinars for healthcare professionals covering various encephalitis types, including Japanese Encephalitis and Tick-Borne Encephalitis, focusing on diagnosis, epidemiology, and prevention.

title: Anonymous Donation
summary: This page provides guidance on how to make anonymous donations to Encephalitis International while explaining the legal and administrative reasons for standard data collection practices.

title: Encephalitis – A Growing Global Threat – Global Policy Launch Event
summary: Encephalitis International and the World Health Organization are launching a Technical Brief to influence global policy and improve diagnostics, treatment, and research for encephalitis.

title: The 22 Club
summary: The 22 Club is Encephalitis International’s business membership initiative designed to foster corporate partnerships that fund global awareness activities and research.

title: RedForWED Buildings
summary: A comprehensive global directory of landmarks and buildings lighting up red on February 22nd to mark World Encephalitis Day and raise public awareness.

title: Experts call for unified classification system for tick-borne encephalitis
summary: A panel of experts led by Encephalitis International has proposed a standardized international classification system for Tick-Borne Encephalitis (TBEV) to enhance clinical severity assessment and research data comparison.

title: World Encephalitis Day Campaign Partners
summary: Encephalitis International invites organizations to become campaign partners for World Encephalitis Day to increase global awareness and fundraise for the encephalitis community.

title: Support Encephalitis International - Donate Online
summary: Encephalitis International has launched a new online donation platform to accept one-off and monthly contributions in multiple currencies to fund global support services, awareness, and research.

summary: Encephalitis International celebrates the achievements of over 300 global fundraisers in 2024 and invites corporate partners to nominate the organization for Charity of the Year in 2025.

title: DPPX encephalitis
summary: An overview of DPPX encephalitis, a rare autoimmune disorder involving antibodies that attack proteins in the gut and brain, leading to gastrointestinal and neurological symptoms.

title: David Brown 1952-2024
summary: Encephalitis International commemorates the legacy of Professor David Brown, an esteemed public health virologist whose career was marked by significant contributions to viral research and understanding the causes of encephalitis.

summary: This article explains the importance of Patient and Public Involvement (PPI) in medical research and outlines how Encephalitis International facilitates collaboration between researchers and those affected by the condition.

summary: A confirmation page thanking donors for their contribution and providing links to join the community and explore resources for encephalitis support and research.

summary: Encephalitis International outlines support services for researchers, including study support, networking, and resource dissemination.

title: Autoimmune causes of seizures and epilepsy
summary: This article explains how autoimmune encephalitis can cause seizures and epilepsy, detailing the condition's discovery, current immunotherapy treatments, and ongoing research to improve diagnosis and outcomes.

summary: This page provides an overview of meningoencephalitis, an inflammation of both the brain and its protective membranes, including its causes, symptoms, diagnosis, and treatment paths.

summary: Jackie Stebbins shares how peer-to-peer events provided life-changing support following her diagnosis of autoimmune encephalitis.

summary: This fundraising campaign supports impactful encephalitis research, including the annual Encephalitis Conference and research grants, to improve global diagnostics, treatment, and recovery.

title: Human Herpes Virus type 6 (HHV-6) encephalitis
summary: A comprehensive guide on HHV-6 encephalitis, detailing its transmission via reactivation in immunocompromised individuals, symptoms in children and adults, and clinical management strategies.

summary: This page provides various ways for individuals and organisations to financially support Encephalitis International through donations, fundraising, and memberships.

title: Donate to Encephalitis International
summary: This page provides options for individuals to make one-off or monthly financial donations to support Encephalitis International's work in research, support services, and education.

title: Eastern Equine Encephalitis (EEE)
summary: This resource provides an overview of Eastern Equine Encephalitis (EEE), a rare but deadly mosquito-borne virus, outlining its symptoms, high mortality rate, and critical prevention strategies.

title: Encephalitis – an invisible disability
summary: This article explores the hidden challenges of living with encephalitis, emphasizing the need for global awareness and support for the invisible disabilities it causes.

title: Encephalitis International is PIF TICK accredited
summary: Encephalitis International has been awarded the PIF TICK, a UK quality mark confirming that its health information is reliable, evidence-based, and trustworthy.

title: Research Blog: The Effects of Parenting Stress on Behavioural Problems in Children and Young People with Acquired Brain Injuries
summary: This research study examines how parental stress influences mental health and behavioural outcomes in children following encephalitis and other acquired brain injuries, highlighting the need for early family intervention.

title: Encephalitis Conference 2024 - Posters
summary: This page showcases innovative poster presentations and researcher biographies from the Encephalitis 2024 Conference, covering a wide range of autoimmune, infectious, and post-infectious encephalitis studies.

summary: A detailed itinerary and speaker list for the second day of the 2024 Encephalitis Conference, showcasing international research on metagenomics, autoimmune markers, and clinical outcomes.

title: Day 1 Encephalitis Conference 2024
summary: The schedule for Day 1 of the Encephalitis Conference 2024 outlines a series of professional presentations, clinical overviews, and datablitz research sessions covering infectious and autoimmune encephalitis.

title: Anti-AMPAR antibody encephalitis
summary: This factsheet provides a medical overview of Anti-AMPAR antibody encephalitis, covering its symptoms such as memory problems and seizures, its frequent association with tumours, and treatment through immunotherapy.

summary: This page details how Encephalitis International supports researchers and research teams through collaboration, partnership, and Patient and Public Involvement (PPI) across all stages of the research process.

title: Psychology Today - The Inflamed Brain (September)
summary: Laura Ryan shares her personal journey with autoimmune encephalitis and how the experience influenced her career path in science, research, and healthcare.

title: Researchers discover latest insights into after-effects of severe COVID-19 on the brain
summary: A major UK study indicates that patients hospitalized with severe COVID-19 suffer from significant long-term cognitive deficits and measurable brain injury equivalent to twenty years of aging.

title: Mpox and encephalitis
summary: This article discusses the neurological complications of the mpox virus, focusing on mpox encephalitis, its symptoms, and the critical role of vaccination and research.

title: Dengue encephalitis
summary: Dengue encephalitis is a rare and severe neurological complication of the mosquito-borne dengue virus, characterized by symptoms like high fever and seizures, requiring supportive care and mosquito prevention.

title: We are closing our X account
summary: Encephalitis International is closing its X account to ensure its digital presence aligns with its values of respect and safety for the encephalitis community.

title: Wunmi's Legacy
summary: Viral encephalitis survivor Wunmi shares her personal recovery journey and explains her decision to support the charity through a legacy gift in her will.

title: What are caregivers’ experiences of having a partner with anti-NMDA receptor encephalitis?
summary: This research study by the University of Southampton seeks UK-based caregivers to share their experiences of supporting a partner through anti-NMDA receptor encephalitis from symptom onset to recovery.

title: ACF 2024: Dr Abdusshakur Muhammad Auwal
summary: A profile of Dr Abdusshakur Muhammad Auwal, an Academic Clinical Fellow researching NeuroCovid pathophysiology and diagnostic biomarkers supported by Encephalitis International.

title: Oropouche virus – what you need to know
summary: This article provides an overview of the emerging Oropouche virus, its transmission via midges and mosquitoes, rising case numbers in South America, and advice for travellers.

title: Psychology Today – The Inflamed Brain (June)
summary: This article discusses the global spread of encephalitis due to environmental factors and provides advice on travel health and prevention measures such as vaccination.

title: Death from encephalitis podcast
summary: A podcast featuring Dr Ava Easton and Prof Arun Venkatesan exploring the difficult topic of encephalitis mortality and the resources available to support those who have lost loved ones.

title: Thank You!
summary: Encephalitis International expresses gratitude to its supporters for their role in the charity's global awareness, research, and professional education achievements.

title: Abi Burton: From Olympian to Encephalitis to Olympian again!
summary: The inspiring journey of Olympic athlete Abi Burton, from her diagnosis of autoimmune NMDA receptor encephalitis to her remarkable recovery and return to the Paris 2024 Olympic Games.

title: Rebecca Adlington
summary: Olympic champion Rebecca Adlington advocates for encephalitis awareness as an Ambassador for Encephalitis International, inspired by her sister's personal recovery from the condition.

title: The Brain Games 2024
summary: The Brain Games 2024 is a 30-day fundraising challenge in September where participants set personal goals to support Encephalitis International's 30th anniversary.

title: World Federation of Neurology Digital Neurology Updates (WNU 2024)
summary: An online conference for healthcare professionals covering neurological research advancements and clinical management strategies.

title: Chandipura encephalitis
summary: Chandipura encephalitis is a viral infection transmitted by sandflies, primarily affecting children in India, with rapid symptom onset and a high mortality rate.

title: The ExTINGUISH Trial of Inebilizumab in NMDAR Encephalitis
summary: This phase-2b clinical trial evaluates the activity and safety of inebilizumab as a potential treatment for patients with moderate-to-severe anti-N-methyl-D-aspartate receptor (NMDAR) encephalitis.

title: Bursary Reports 2023
summary: This page features reports from medical professionals who were awarded bursaries to attend the Encephalitis 2023 conference, detailing their research and experiences.

title: Intersectoral Global Action Plan (IGAP) is unveiled by the WHO
summary: The World Health Organization has launched a new toolkit to support the Intersectoral Global Action Plan (IGAP), a strategic initiative designed to improve global neurological care, research, and multi-sectoral support for conditions including encephalitis.

title: Murray Valley encephalitis
summary: An overview of Murray Valley encephalitis, a mosquito-borne viral infection found in Australia and surrounding regions, detailing its symptoms, diagnosis, and preventative measures.

title: Mapping the brain
summary: International researchers have developed a detailed 3D brain atlas identifying over 3,000 cell types to better understand neurological diseases and develop targeted treatments.

title: Craghoppers Partnership
summary: Encephalitis International and outdoor apparel brand Craghoppers have collaborated to promote travel health awareness and provide information on infectious encephalitis prevention.

title: Psychology Today - The Inflamed Brain (May)
summary: An exploration of the history and success of vaccines in public health, specifically highlighting their role in preventing infectious conditions like Japanese Encephalitis.

title: Brain Innovation Days Events
summary: The 4th edition of the Brain Innovation Days in Brussels aims to connect the brain ecosystem to accelerate research, innovation, and investment across the lifespan.

title: Carers' stories
summary: This page features videos and personal stories from caregivers and parents of individuals affected by encephalitis, offering advice and insights into the impact on daily life.

title: Fundraising Resources
summary: Encephalitis International provides a comprehensive bank of downloadable tools, including posters, social media assets, and sponsorship forms, to help individuals fundraise and raise awareness.

title: Parents Survey: Behavioural problems in children and young people with acquired brain injuries and parents’ wellbeing
summary: A research survey for parents of children and young people aged 4-25 with an acquired brain injury to explore the relationship between child behavioural problems and parental wellbeing.

title: Encephalitis International Vaccine Consensus Statement
summary: This consensus statement from Encephalitis International reaffirms the safety and efficacy of vaccines, refutes the link between immunisations and autism, and highlights the importance of vaccination in preventing infectious encephalitis.

summary: A comprehensive hub for medical and research professionals offering access to clinical guides, research support, educational webinars, and information on the annual Encephalitis Conference.

summary: This page outlines various ways for patients, caregivers, and medical professionals to get involved in and support encephalitis research projects.

summary: This page provides a directory of active research calls and clinical trials for medical professionals and researchers, focusing on social connection in brain injury, NMDAR encephalitis treatments, and infection-related headaches.

summary: This page serves as a hub for information on vaccine-preventable encephalitis, offering factsheets, personal case studies, and professional resources to improve global awareness and vaccine uptake.

summary: Dr Ava Easton discusses the severity of measles as a public health crisis and its direct link to encephalitis and bereavement.

title: Vaccine-Preventable Encephalitis
summary: This page provides an overview of various types of encephalitis that can be prevented through vaccination, including Measles, Influenza, and Tick-Borne Encephalitis.

summary: This research study by King’s College London uses a smartphone app to investigate how real-time coping with daily stressors affects the mood and mental health of individuals recovering from encephalitis.

summary: Encephalitis International provides access to an online hub of clinical tools, research resources, and training materials for healthcare professionals, developed in collaboration with the University of Liverpool.

title: Encephalitis vs. encephalopathy
summary: This article explains the clinical distinctions between encephalitis, which involves brain inflammation typically caused by infection or autoimmune response, and encephalopathy, a broader term for brain dysfunction caused by various factors like organ failure or injury.

summary: A set of frequently asked questions where a volunteer patient representative shares their experience and the importance of participating in Patient and Public Involvement (PPI) for encephalitis research.

summary: Encephalitis International describes its Patient and Public Involvement (PPI) initiatives, highlighting how individuals affected by encephalitis can contribute to and shape clinical research.

summary: This resource outlines the benefits and best practices of Patient and Public Involvement (PPI) in encephalitis research to ensure studies are inclusive, relevant, and grounded in lived experience.

title: Patient and Public Involvement in Research
summary: Encephalitis International facilitates the involvement of patients, families, and carers in research to guide experts, test treatments, and improve encephalitis study outcomes.

title: Influenza encephalitis
summary: Influenza encephalitis is a rare but serious neurological complication of the influenza virus that primarily affects children and young adults, requiring prompt diagnosis and supportive care.

title: Why is it important to be involved in research?
summary: This page explains the significance of Patient and Public Involvement (PPI) in encephalitis research and provides a registration form for survivors and their families to hear about future study opportunities.

title: Booklets
summary: A collection of information booklets covering what encephalitis is, its types, diagnosis, treatments, and recovery, including resources for patients, caregivers, and professionals.

title: Factsheets and guides
summary: A library of educational resources including factsheets and guides for patients, families, and healthcare professionals covering the diagnosis, treatment, and long-term management of encephalitis.

title: Understanding Encephalitis Animation Series
summary: An educational animation series available in multiple languages covering the symptoms, diagnosis, treatment, and recovery process of encephalitis for patients and their families.

title: What is encephalitis leaflet
summary: A resource page providing downloadable leaflets in multiple languages that explain encephalitis and the support services offered by Encephalitis International.

title: What is encephalitis booklet
summary: This page provides access to an eight-page introductory booklet available in multiple languages that explains the symptoms, diagnosis, treatment, and after-effects of encephalitis.

title: 22 Highlights From World Encephalitis Day 2024
summary: A comprehensive summary of the global events, social media impact, personal stories, and research initiatives that marked the 11th anniversary of World Encephalitis Day.

title: World Encephalitis Day coverage
summary: A compilation of media coverage and news articles from World Encephalitis Day 2024, featuring personal stories, research news, and awareness initiatives.

title: Psychology Today – The Inflamed Brain (February)
summary: A personal perspective by Juliana Ortiz on her diagnosis of NMDAR-antibody encephalitis at age 14 and the profound impact it had on her life and education.

title: Why is encephalitis diagnosis important?
summary: A global survey by Encephalitis International highlights that many emergency medical professionals lack confidence and training in recognizing encephalitis, leading to a call for improved education and global awareness.

title: World Encephalitis Day 2024 - how to get involved
summary: This page outlines various ways for individuals and communities to participate in World Encephalitis Day 2024, including social media activities, visiting landmarks, and supporting a fundraising appeal for medical professional training.

title: Varicella Zoster Virus Encephalitis
summary: This resource explains Varicella Zoster Virus (VZV) encephalitis, covering its origin from chickenpox or shingles, clinical symptoms, diagnosis via CSF testing, and treatment with antiviral medication.
